action.action-desc: Mr. Biggs introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to make voting in a Federal election by an unlawfully present alien an aggravated felony, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Voter Integrity Protection Act.

subsection.text: Section 101(a)(43) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(43)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (T), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (U), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: an offense described in section 611 of title 18, United States Code, committed by an alien who is unlawfully present in the United States.

subsection.text: Section 237(a)(2) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Any alien who is unlawfully present in the United States and who knowingly commits a violation of section 611 of title 18, United States Code, is deportable.
